english: younger sister; little sister; younger female sibling; (form of address) young girl

etymology.description: 妹 ×2 = younger sister; reduplication adds an affectionate/familiar tone.
etymology.interpretation: Reduplicating kinship terms makes them colloquial and warm (cf. 妈妈, 爸爸), so 妹妹 feels affectionate. It can refer to one’s younger sister or be used as a polite address to a young girl.

examples.chinese: 我有一个妹妹(我有一個妹妹)。
我和妹妹去看电影(我和妹妹去看電影)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hé mèimei qù kàn diànyǐng.
examples.english: My younger sister and I are going to watch a movie.

examples.chinese: 那位妹妹，请这边走(那位妹妹，請這邊走)。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi mèimei, qǐng zhè biān zǒu.
examples.english: Young lady, please come this way.
